metadata.title: CVE-2020-1720 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in PostgreSQL's "ALTER ... DEPENDS ON EXTENSION", wheresub-commands did not perform authorization checks. An authenticatedattacker could use this flaw in certain configurations to perform dropobjects such as function, triggers, et al., leading to database corruption.This issue affects PostgreSQL versions before 12.2, before 11.7, before10.12 and before 9.6.17.

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
postgresql-9.1: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
